H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H4834.def: = process by which an event causes grief and suffering to those experiencing it

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2266.def: = state in which two or more inanimate objects are joined together

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H5205.def: literally: movement of lips; hence: = action by which humans utter words

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H3511.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3811.def: = action by which humans spend all their forces on a certain activity

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H5712.def: = a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose

H7059.def: = causative action by which deities take hold of humans ► in order to harm them

H5707.def: = a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

H3585.def: = state of having lost body volume

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2963.def: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

H7852.def: = state in which humans harbor resentment against (other) humans for things they did in the past

H2786.def: = to gnash or grind one's teeth עַל with regard to someone else ► in order to express one's hostility

H3913.def: = causative action by which humans use a hammer to shape iron and other metals

20.gl: to give someone a menacing glare

H3895.def: = the lower bony structure of the skull of humans and certain animals that forms the framework of the mouth and holds the teeth

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H3399.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which humans move in a certain direction with speed and without thinking of the consequences

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

18.gl: to thrust (someone) into the clutches (of someone else)

H7961.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H4307.def: = elite group of soldiers, ► responsible for protecting buildings and high-ranking officials

H7228.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H6398.def: = causative action by which humans use a sharp implement to split an object, either partially or completely

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H6556.def: = large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H8609.def: = to join together pieces of cloth or animal skin with stitches using a needle and thread from local plants ... for making clothing or shelter

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H1539.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a human being

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H2560.def: = process by which liquids form small bubbles, ◄ due to agitation or fermentation

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H6079.def: = the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H2134.def: = state in which a substance has not been mixed or adulterated with any other substance

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H2201.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H5707.def: = a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7717.def: = a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H1811.def: = state in which an object has a hole or crack in it, so that liquids or other objects can pass through

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H857.def: = to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before
